Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add ownership requests to manage packages page" (#4722) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently, there is no way for the pending owner of a package ownership request to view and accept the request outside of the email that is sent. As a result, if the email fails to send, the pending owner will never know that they were ever requested and--even if they do know they were requested--cannot accept the request!

This PR adds management of package ownership requests to the manage packages page. It shows both incoming and outgoing requests. Users can accept and reject requests for them to become owners of a package and can cancel requests they had made.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18014088/28993858-4e74c8d8-7975-11e7-9a5d-54e861eca2d3.png)

This is a continuation of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/4512, which had to be closed and rebased due to strange issues with GitHub.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Add page to view ownership requests " (#4512) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
(Quick weekend project I did.)

Currently, there is no way for the pending owner of a package ownership request to view and accept the request outside of the email that is sent. As a result, if the email fails to send, the pending owner will never know that they were ever requested and--even if they do know they were requested--cannot accept the request!

This PR adds a page for users to manage their package ownership requests. It shows both incoming and outgoing requests. From this page, users can accept and reject requests for them to become owners of a package and can cancel requests they had made.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18014088/28993858-4e74c8d8-7975-11e7-9a5d-54e861eca2d3.png)

The link to this page is in the dropdown menu at the top of the page.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18014088/28993874-97931948-7975-11e7-91dd-23b2e946f285.png)

Will tidy up and add some tests later.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Move logic needed by validation orchestrator out of PackageService into CorePackageService " (#4721) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Also, add the `UpdatePackageStatusAsync` method for package status transitions.

I'm open to naming suggestions, but I thought this makes sense since it's in the `NuGetGallery.Core` assembly.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add model validation for package upload" (#4712) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Adding model validation to VerifyPackage, same as done for Edit

Issue is #4706. Note that Edit/Upload currently would require refresh on validation errors because handleErrors does a bindData(null). Isn't ideal, but leaving as-is because:
- Upload uses single error handler for cancel, submit, upload failure
- Upload/Edit form is long, so it's not apparent that validation failed unless user scrolls up

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Prefix] Fix the bug with absolute namespace reservation for an owner" (#4719) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
There was a bug which would mark all package registrations under an owner which started with the reserved prefix even if the prefix is an absolute namespace.

This fixes it, plus added test.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Package is not compatible with net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5)" (#4259) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): nuget.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):  3.5.0.1938

dotnet.exe --version (if appropirate): 4.5

VS version (if appropriate): 2015

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): win10 v1511 10586.753

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: Works fine for my colleagues. Used to work on my PC as well before I re-installed windows and VS, so the issue is specific for my PC only.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. I'm calling nuget.exe -restore

2. The error message that I'm getting is :
Package NUnit 3.5.0 is not compatible with net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5). Package NUnit 3.5.0 supports:
  - dotnet (.NETPlatform,Version=v5.0)
  - net20 (.NETFramework,Version=v2.0)
  - net35 (.NETFramework,Version=v3.5)
  - net40 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.0)
  - net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5)
  - portable-monoandroid10+monotouch10+net45+win8+wp8+wpa81+xamarinios10+xamarinmac (.NETPortable,Version=v0.0,Profile=n
et45+win8+wp8+wpa81+Xamarin.Mac+MonoAndroid10+MonoTouch10+Xamarin.iOS10)
Package Moq 4.5.16 is not compatible with net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5). Package Moq 4.5.16 supports: net45 (.NETFr
amework,Version=v4.5)
Package Castle.Core 3.3.3 is not compatible with net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5). Package Castle.Core 3.3.3 supports:

  - net35 (.NETFramework,Version=v3.5)
  - net40-client (.NETFramework,Version=v4.0,Profile=Client)
  - net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5)
  - sl4 (Silverlight,Version=v4.0)
  - sl5 (Silverlight,Version=v5.0)
One or more packages are incompatible with .NETFramework,Version=v4.5.
Package NUnit 3.5.0 is not compatible with net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5) / win. Package NUnit 3.5.0 supports:
  - dotnet (.NETPlatform,Version=v5.0)
  - net20 (.NETFramework,Version=v2.0)
  - net35 (.NETFramework,Version=v3.5)
  - net40 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.0)
  - net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5)
  - portable-monoandroid10+monotouch10+net45+win8+wp8+wpa81+xamarinios10+xamarinmac (.NETPortable,Version=v0.0,Profile=n
et45+win8+wp8+wpa81+Xamarin.Mac+MonoAndroid10+MonoTouch10+Xamarin.iOS10)
Package Moq 4.5.16 is not compatible with net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5) / win. Package Moq 4.5.16 supports: net45 (
.NETFramework,Version=v4.5)
Package Castle.Core 3.3.3 is not compatible with net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5) / win. Package Castle.Core 3.3.3 sup
ports:
  - net35 (.NETFramework,Version=v3.5)
  - net40-client (.NETFramework,Version=v4.0,Profile=Client)
  - net45 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.5)
  - sl4 (Silverlight,Version=v4.0)
  - sl5 (Silverlight,Version=v5.0)
One or more packages are incompatible with .NETFramework,Version=v4.5 (win).

The project.json file looks like this:
{
   "dependencies": {
      "Microsoft.PowerShell.3.ReferenceAssemblies": "1.0.0",
      "NUnit": "3.5.0",
      "Moq": "4.5.16",
      "VMware.VimAutomation.Sdk.Impl": "*"
   },
  "frameworks": {
    "net45": {}
  },
  "runtimes": {
    "win": {}
  }
}

I don't understand why nuget says that the package does not support net45 and at the same time says that it does support net45.
...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbose | etc...)

Errors in C:\projects\vicore4powercli\main\test\VMware.VimAutomation.ViCore.UnitTest\VMware.VimAutomation.ViCore.UnitTes
t.csproj

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Duplicate errors when adding project dependency" (#5921) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I am trying to create a NuGet package with NuGetizer 3000 in Visual Studio 2017 15.3.5. When I add a reference to the project that I need to create the NuGet packgage of, I get a lot of the same errors on different dll's:
"Duplicate package source files detected for target package file path 'lib\netstandard2.0\System.Diagnostics.Debug.dll'".

![nuget_dependencies](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14166838/30727152-cdd54024-9f92-11e7-93d8-a163ffd219c4.png)
![nuget_errors](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14166838/30727182-054090e0-9f93-11e7-8cc9-0c1db86de711.png)

What is the right way to add dependencies to the NuGet package? Do I need to manually add them?

NuGet version: 4.3.1

Events.RelatedBody:
It should error for icon URL. For others, it should warn.

cc: @joelverhagen to link existing bugs on this as I could not find one.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.exe pack should pack all kinds of projects including .NET Core projects" (#5918) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Related issue: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4054

Today NuGet.exe pack does not work on PackageReference projects. This has users confused as many users have been using nuget.exe to pack for packages.config and project.json based projects.

The following should just work:

`nuget.exe pack <project>.csproj`
`nuget.exe pack <name>.nuspec`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget package added but not used TFS" (#5890) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi guys! I have some problem with my packages which i add in runtime with this code:
``  <Target Name="BeforeResolveReferences" 
<Exec Command=""\\out-oracle\nuget\nuget" update $(MSBuildProjectDirectory)\packages.config -id Sbt.CMS -FileConflictAction overwrite -Source \\out-oracle\nuget -Version 1.0.$(BUILD_BUILDID); "\\out-oracle\nuget\nuget" update $(MSBuildProjectDirectory)\packages.config -id Sbt.CMS.Infrastructure -FileConflictAction overwrite -Source \\out-oracle\nuget -Version 1.0.$(BUILD_BUILDID)" /></Target>``
Packages successfully added but not used ans i show this error in TFS logs:
``2017-09-14T16:44:03.9210456Z Output file "obj\Debug\Sbt.CMS.Cashflow.Infrastructure.dll" does not exist.
2017-09-14T16:44:03.9210456Z Task "Csc"``
And then a lot of errors about missing reference when msbuild tries to build solution. Who knows, why?
How I may say msbuild copy this refernce to output folder and use it?

NuGet 4.3
TFS 2017 Build Step Visual Studio Build
[buildLog19.txt](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/1303801/buildLog19.txt)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Announcing the NuGet 'Announcements' repo!" (#1) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
| Spec wiki| Discussion issue| 
| ------------- |:-------------| 
| _None_| https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4088|

## Announcing the **Announcements** repo!
As a step towards engaging with the community early on, we have created the **NuGet/Announcements** repo to propose new features and to get early feedback before the team starts implementing these features. This repo will be used for team announcements only. To file a bug or start a discussion, please create a new issue on [NuGet client](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues) or [NuGet server](https://github.com/nuget/NuGetGallery/issues). .

All items posted to this repo are locked, but will typically have links to separate discussion threads on one of the NuGet repos, just like this announcement can be discussed more on this issue: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4088. 
Please use these discussion threads for questions and comments about a particular announcement.

## Receiving Notifications

Subscribe to this repo to be notified about major changes, upcoming features and other noteworthy announcements in NuGet.

![subscribe](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14800916/29544263-bea081fa-869b-11e7-9c18-b576890ba049.png)

## Using the Issues list

Use the [Feature](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Feature) and [Breaking Change](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Breaking%20Change) labels to see what's new and changed.

New feature announcements will have one of the following labels:
* [Reviewing](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Reviewing) - Feature being proposed and is undergoing review within the team and the community. 
* [Reviewed](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Reviewed) - Feature has been reviewed and necessary feedback incorporated. The feature is ready to be implemented.
* [Implemented](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Implemented) - Feature has been implemented.
